TEI.p: [Daily Journal for 1938, black leather binding with red leather spine. Pre-printed calendars appear on the inside front and back covers; pre-printed information also appears on 6 pages: calendar and publishing information on 2 preliminary pages; 2 pages advertising the company’s services in the last third of the notebook; and the 2 final pages printed with legal holidays and postage rates. The 183 pages dedicated to the calendar year are lined pages divided in half so that, except for the page for December 31, each leaf contains two dates. Following this are 7 pre-printed pages headed "Memoranda" and 24 pre-printed pages for bookkeeping: the first 12 of these, each headed with the month, is dedicated to cash received and paid; the second 12, each again headed with the month, are dedicated to “Bills Payable” and “Receivable.” First image with MM's writing is the inside front cover. RML number written in pencil: 1250/7.]

Relevant to publications: ["Comment" in The Dial 80 (February 1926); "Emily Dickinson" (1933); "It is Not Forbidden to Think" (1936); "We Will Walk Like the Tapir" (1943); "There is a War That Never Ends" (1943); "One Times One" (1944); "Feeling and Precision" (1944); "Humility, Concentration, and Gusto" (1949); "E. McKnight Kauffer" (1949); "W.H. Auden" (1952); note to "To a Snail" in Collected Poems (1952)].
